column14: Asylum seekers and refugees are protected by SA’s Constitution when they obey the law and accept the asylum seekers' duties. It’s your duty to go to the RRO when you arrive in SA and truthfully explain why you want asylum. It’s your duty to obey the law. If you commit a crime in SA you will be prosecuted like any other South African. Peace is your right and duty. If you assist in armed attacks against your country, you may lose your refugee status and go to jail.

column14: Fill out the eligibility form. Answer honestly. You will be interviewed later so give as much detail of your true story. Bring with you all documents that show who you are and where you come from. Copies will be made so you keep the originals. After fingerprints are taken, a case number and file number will be given. Write down these important numbers.

column14: Don’t pay anyone – no officials, no security guards. The process is free. Fight corruption. Tip: If a DHA official asks for a bribe, get his/her name. Note down the official’s physical features, as well as the date and time of the incident. Tip: There is no need to pay fees. Call the DHA’s toll-free hotline on 0800-601-190 to report corruption. You will remain anonymous.

column14: You will get a Section 22 permit (Asylum-seeker permit) when you apply. It's proof you've applied. You're not a refugee yet. Your permit lets you work or study in SA. Check the permit conditions or ask. Know if it’s valid for 1 month or 3. Make a copy of the permit. Always carry it with you. Keep renewing it before it expires. A decision can take months or years. Tip: If you don’t renew your Section 22 permit before expiry, you could be arrested/detained/fined.
column16: Utapata kifungo cha 22 (Kibali cha Wakimbizi) Ukiomba.Ni ushahidi.Wewe si mkimbizi.Kibali chako kinakuruhusu kusoma na kufanya kazi SA.Angalia hali ya kibali na ulize kama iko halali miezi 1 au 3.Fanya nakala ya kibali.Weka upya. Tip: Usipo fanya upya kibali cha kifungu 22 ,Unaweza fungwa/zuizini/faini.

column14: You'll be interviewed when you apply for asylum. Expect questions about you and your country. You may bring a legal representative or interpreter. Your representative can only observe. You can also bring witnesses, affidavits or other evidence to help. You will get a decision on the day or later. Get your permit stamped before you leave. Married couples must both be interviewed if applying together. Name your wife or children in another country to add them to your file.
column16: Utakua na mahojiano ukiomba hifadhi. Maswali  yanaokuhusu na nchi yako. Unaweza leta mwanasheria au mkalimani. Huyo atachunguza tu.Unaweza pia kumleta mshahidi, maandiko chini ya kiapo au ushahidi nyingine. Utapata uamuzi hiyo siku. Pata mhuri kwenye kibali kabla kuondoka. Wenandoa watahojiwa pamoja. Taja  ya majina ya mwanamke na watoto pale popote wako wawekwe  kwenye faili  moja.

column14: If you don’t speak a language of SA well enough to explain your claim, you need an interpreter. If DHA doesn't provide one, you must acquire and pay for your own. Get a person you trust to translate word-for-word; not one who’ll make up a story to get you refugee status. Speak slowly and ask to have your statements read back to you. Ask the official to write down any changes made. Sign the form. Your legal help, a testifying witness or a compatriot can't interpret for you.
column16: Kama huwezi kuongea lugha ya SA vizuli ili  ukaeleza madai yako,unamhitaji mkalimani. DHA haitoi  hata mmoja, lazima ujilipie. Pata mtu mwanifu  neno-kwa-neno; siyo mwenye atasema maneno ili utape hadhi ya ukimbizi.ongea polepole na omba wakusomee hadithi yako. Uliza afisa kama kuna mabadiliko. Saini fomu. Mwanasheria ,mshahidi wako au mwenzako hawezi kukutafsiria.

column14: Some university law clinics and human rights organisations offer free legal advice to asylum seekers and refugees. The UNHCR has legal counsellors specialising in refugee law in 5 SA cities. See ‘Useful Services’ for more info. Legal counsellors can advise on your asylum application or help you with an appeal if your asylum application has been rejected. Counsellors can only give you legal advice. They don’t provide accommodation or food. See Social Services for more info.
column16: Kliniki za sheria fulani  katika Vyuo vikuu na mashirika ya haki za bianadamu hushauri kwa  bure wanaotafuta hifadhi na wakimbizi. UNHCR ina mashauri maalumu wa kisheria katika sheria za ukimbizi katika  miji 5 ya SA. Ona 'huduma maalum' nyinginezo . Mshauri ya kisheria wanaweza kukusaidi kwa ombi ya hifadhi au usaidizi wa kupiga rufaa kama hadhi yako imekataliwa. Mshauri husaidia na ushauri. Hawapeani makao au chakula.

column14: Private attorneys can help with your asylum application, appeal or SCRA review. You may need to pay for these services. Or contact LHR – they may be able to help or refer you. The Law Society of South Africa has a list of attorneys with experience in refugee law – See ‘Useful Services’. Tip: Always ask about a lawyer’s fees before you accept their services. Make sure your lawyer has the right qualifications. To check, contact the Law Society of SA on 012-366-8800.
column16: Wakili binafsi wanaweza kusaidia na ombi, rufaa au SCRA mapito. Lazima ulipe huduma. Or pigia LHR-wanaeza kukusaidia. Law society ya South Africa wako na wakili wana utaalamu wa sheria za wakimbizi. Ona 'huduma muhimu'. Tip: ulizia wakili hulipwa ngapi. Hikisha wakili  na kufuzu. Pigia Law Society ya Sa kwa 012-366-8800.

column14: If your application is approved, you’ll get a Section 24 permit (refugee status). Your permit is valid for 2 to 4 years. You must renew it at your RRO before it expires. Refugees can apply for a refugee ID (maroon ‘ID’) and travel documents. It may take time. Only apply for travel documents if you have a refugee ID. If you don’t, and must travel for an emergency, contact UNHCR. Tip: If you travel back to your country, you could lose your refugee status in SA.
column16: Ombi lako likipita,utapata kibali ya  24 (hadhi ya ukimbizi). Kibali  chako kiko halali  miaka 2 au 4. Fanya upya kwa RRO kabla hakijaisha. Mkimbizi huweza kuomba ID (marron 'ID') na nakala ya  kusafikiria. Huchukua muda. Omba nakala ya kusafiri kama una ID. Usipofanya na unataka kusafiri kwa gafla,pigia UNHCR. Mwanga: Ukienda inchi yako utakosa ukimbizi ya SA.

column14: If a RRO rejects your application, you’re not recognised as a refugee. You have 30 days to give a notice of appeal, otherwise you must document your stay in another way or leave SA. The reason for rejection affects your appeal. If your application. was fraudulent or abusive, the Standing Committee of Refugee Affairs will review it. You have 14 days to give them a written statement on why you disagree, at the RRO that issued the rejection letter. Ask a LHR counsellor for help.
column16: Kama RRO anakataa ombi lako,hautambuliki kama mkimbizi uko na siku 30 kutoa taarifa ya rufaa,ama ufanye namna nyingine  ya kuishi au kuondoka SA. Sababu uhathiri rufaa.  Kama ombi lako ulaghai au unyayasaji, Kamati ya Kudumu Mambo ya Wakimbizi watayikagua. Unasiku 14 kupatiana kauli ya kutokubaliana na uamzi katika ofisi ya RRO ilyokupa barua ya kukataliwa.Omba LHR usaidizi.

column14: It’s your right: to have your asylum application processed and decided upon in a fair and transparent way; not to be deported to your country of origin; or be prosecuted for unlawful entry or your presence in SA while your application is awaiting a decision.
column16: Ni haki yako: kuwa na ombi lako la hifadhi kushughulikwa na kuliamua katika  haki na kiwazi ; usirudishwe nchi yako ya asili ; au kushitakiwa kwa ajili ya kuingia kinyume cha sheria au kuwepo  katika SA wakati maombi yako anasubiri uamuzi huo.

column14: Every refugee or asylum seeker with a valid permit has the right to work in SA. You can be employed or run your own business. You don't need an extra work visa.
column16: Kila mkimbizi au mwombaji wa ukimbizi mwenye kibali halali ana haki ya kufanya kazi SA. Unaweza kusajiliwa au kufanay biashara yake mwenyewe. Hauitaji kibali cha kufanay kazi.

column14: You have the right to basic health and reproductive health care services in SA. You cannot be refused emergency medical treatment. Hospital workers don’t always know the rights of refugees and asylum seekers with valid permits. You can contact Lawyers for Human Rights if you have a problem accessing public health services.
column16: Una haki ya matibabu ya afya na uzazi SA. Huwezi kakataliwa matibabu ya dharura . Wafanyi kazi wa hospitali hawajui muda wowote haki za wakimbizi au wombaji wa ukimbizi wenye vibali halali. Pigia Wanasheria wa Haki za Binadamu kama unashidwa kupata huduma ya afya.

column14: Everyone has the right to basic education in SA. You must have a valid study permit to study in SA. Are you in the country on another valid permit? Check first if your permit allows you to study in SA. Some conditions might apply.
column16: Kila mtu ana haki ya elimu ya msingi SA. Lazima uwe na kibali halali kusomea SA. Uko nchini kwenye kibali  kingine  halali? Angalia kama kibali chako kinakuruhusu kusomea SA. Masharti mengine anaweza  kuhusika nawe.

column14:
You have a right to food, water & housing. Organisations offer limited help but you’ll have to support yourself soon afterwards. See ‘Useful Services’ for religious establishments that can help. 

You must look after your social & economic needs. SA Gov, NGOs & UNHCR only help special cases. UNHCR has a limited role in SA (with no camp) & can’t provide for all needs. Along with NGOs, they give limited help in cities with RROs & only for the most vulnerable (moms & kids who’ve been in SA under 2 months, single men with special needs, the ill & disabled). Help can include food & basic housing up to 3 months. Most refugee communities offer little material help, but can offer support. You can access public services like healthcare & education.
column16: Una haki ya kuwa na maji , chakula& mahali pakulala. Mashilika  hutoa misaada midogo lakini ni   lazima ujisaidie baadaye . Angalia 'Hudumu muhimu' za taasisi za makanisa anaotoa misaada. Lazima ujisaide wewe mwenyewe kwenye mahitaji yako ya kijamii na kiuchumi . Serikali ya SA ,NGOs & UNHCR husaidia kesi maalum tu  .UNHCR ina jukumu ndogo (bila kambi) & haiwezi kusaidia mahitaji yote.  Pamoja na  NGOs wanatoa  misaada midogo kwenye miji  ina  RRO, kwenye wanaoishi katika mazingira magumu tu (mama&watoto  hawajakaa zaidi ya miezi 2, wanaume wenye mahitaji maalum, wagonjwa & walemavu).Misaada ingeweza kuwa chaukula au kodi ya miezi 3. Jamii za wakimbizi husaidia kidogo lakini ni msaada wa msingi,k.Unaweza kupata huduma za umma  kama masomo na afya.

column14: The law protects refugees and asylum seekers from unlawful evictions. The landlord must have a court order before he can evict you. Remember: only a court can force you to leave. The landlord cannot threaten you or use force to remove you from the property. Contact the Rental Housing Tribunal on 011-630-5035 or 0800-046-873 if there’s a dispute or if you feel you’ve been unfairly treated.
column16: Sheria hulinda kinyume cha sheria. Mwenye nyumba lazima pate ili kabla kukufukuza. Kumbuka.ni mahakama too huweza nguvu. Mwenye nyumba hana haki ya kukufuza au kukutoa kwa mali. Pigia Rental Housing Tribunal 011-630-5035 au 0800-046-873 kama una zozo au kutendwa.

column14: SA’s constitution protects the rights of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual & Transgender Individuals (LGBTI). LGBT victims must report crimes to the police. LGBT victims of hate speech can lay a complaint with the SAHRC. Ask for legal assistance if you’re struggling to lodge your claim. Go to the contact list for more info. For LGBTI support in Johannesburg: call GALA on 011-717-4239. Or in Pretoria: call Out Wellbeing on 012-430-3272. In Durban: call Gay & Lesbian Network 033-342-6165.
column16: Katibu ya SA hulinda Lesbian Gay, Bisexual &Transgender  (LGBT).  Mwathirika wa chuki za LGBT huenda polisi kuripoti. Pia anaweza kufungua shutaka la chuki katika  SAHRC. Omba msaada wa kisheria kama unashindwa kufungua madai. Nenda kwa orodha ya mawasiliano kupata habari zaidi. Kwa msaada ya LGBTI  katika  Johannesburg: pigia  GALA 011-717-4239 au Pretoria : Pigia Wellbeing 012-430-3272. Durban: pigia Gay & Lesbian Network 033-342-6165.

column14: Women and children have the right to live free from abuse. All types of abuse must be reported to the police. Remember: a protection order can prevent more violence. Violence can mean intimidation, physical, sexual or verbal abuse, being threatened with abuse or when you lose your freedom. Abuse of women and children is illegal in SA. Get free legal help from women and children’s organisations or call the toll-free helpline on 0800-150-150 for help and counselling.
column16: Mama na Watoto wana haki za kuishi huru bila  kunyanyaswa .Kila aina ya unyanyasaji ni lazimaa iripotiwe kwa polisi. Kumbuka. Amri ya mahakama ya ulizi huzuia vurugu. Vurugu huweza kua vitisho, kupigwa ,kijinsia au matusi,Vitisho vya unyanyasajiau kama unapoteza uhuru. Unyanyasaji wa  mama na mtoto ni kunyume  na sheria . Pata shauri ya kisheria ya bure kwenye mashirika ya wanawake na watoto au piga simu bure  0800-150-150 kwa msaada.

column14: Valid permit holders are safe from arrest unless they break the law. Police or immigration officials may request your permit to prove your stay is legal, or you may be arrested/detained. If you're arrested, you must prove that you're allowed to be in SA. You will go to a police station until the DHA verifies your identity within 48 hours. Never bribe an officer to avoid being arrested or to get out of jail – it's illegal! Tip: Always carry your permit or certified copy.
column16: Wenye vibali halali hawawezi kukamtiwa bure  labda wavunje sheria. Polisi au afisa uhamaji  anaweza kukuuliza kibali kuhakiskisha kama unakaa halali, au unaweza kufungwa/ kuwa kizuizini. Ukifungwa thibitisha kwamba una kubaliwa SA. Utaenda kituo cha polisi  mpaka DHA ihakikishe wewe uko nani katika masaa 48. Usihonge afisa kwa  kukwepa kufungwa. Mwanga: tembea na  kibali  au nakala ya kitambulisho iliyothibitishwa.

column14: There are legal ways out of your arrest. It may take time. Ask to speak to a lawyer. It is your right. If you are arrested and have a valid visa, ask a friend or family to give copies of your valid documents to the DHA. Remember: You have the right to get legal representation if you are arrested. Tip: If you go to a magistrate’s court, you can ask for ‘legal aid’. You will be able to speak to a lawyer for free.
column16: Kuna njia za kisheria zakufunguliwa. Inaweza chukua muda. Omba  wakili.Ni haki yako. Kama umefungwa na kibali halali,ambia  rafiki au familia kupatia DHA nakala ya kibali chako. Kumbuka. Una haki ya kuwa na  mwanasherai kama unafungwa . Tip: Ukienda mahakamani, uliza 'mwanasheria wa bure'. Unaweza kuongea na wakili bure.

column14: The DHA officer should verify your documents within 48 hours. It's your duty to carry your permit on you. You have a free phone call to call your friend for a copy of your permit. You can make a statement to DHA that you disagree with the decision to detain or deport you. You can only be detained for 30 days unless a court extends your detention. When the court makes its decision, you must be informed of this in writing, you can gives reasons why you don't agree.
column16: Afisa wa DHA analizimishwa kuthibitisha hati yako ya msaa 48. Niwajibu wako ya kutembea na  kibali. Una haki ya kupigia rafiki yako akupe nakala ya kabili.Unaweza kutoa kauli kwa DHA ya kwamba wewe umekataa kizuizi au kufukuzwa. Unaweza tu kuwa kizuizini kwa siku 30 isipokuwa mahakama inaongeza muda. Wakati mahakama hufanya uamuzi wake , lazima upate taarifa  hii kwa maandishi, unaweza kupana sababu kwa nini unakataa

column14: If you are taken to the Deportation Centre, you may contact a lawyer for legal advice. Lawyers for Human Rights visits the centre every week. Ask your family to notify LHR about your situation and that you need help. If you don’t have legitimate reasons to stay in SA with the necessary documents, you’ll be kept at the centre and deported back home. Contact Lawyers for Human Rights if your conditions of detention are unsafe or violate your dignity.
column16: Ukipelekwa kituo cha kufukuzwa,Pigia wakili kwa mashauri ya kisheria. Wanasheria wa Haki za Binadamu hutembelea centa kila wiki. Uliza familia kuwaarifu LHR hali yako na kubambia kama  unahitaji msaada. Kama hakuna sababu na hati sahihi ya kukaa SA, utawekwa kwenye  kituo cha kufukuzwa na utarudishwa nyumbani. Wasiliana na Wanasheria wa Haki za Binadamu kama hali yako ya kizuizini si salama au inakiuka hadhi yako.

column14: If a child enters SA in the care of a relative who's not a parent, the caregiver must go to the Children’s Court and apply to be legal guardian. Refugee status is given to children/dependants when the head of the family/household’s application is approved. A child’s case may be stronger than the parents' – if so, submit an independent application for asylum. A legal representative, parent or legal guardian must always accompany a child asylum seeker at his/her interviews.
column16: Kama mtoto akiingia SA bila mzazi, mlezi lazima aende mahakamani ya Watoto kuomba ruhusa ya kuwa mlezi wa kisheria.Hadhi ya Ukimbizi hupewa watoto/ wategemezi kama mkuu wa famila alipata . Kesi ya mtoto inaweza kuwa kubwa kushinda ya wazazi, kwa hivyo anaweza kujitegemea kwa ombi la hadhi. Mwakilishi,mzazi au mlezi lazima akuwe mtoto mkimbizi katika mahojiano.

column14: A child asylum seeker is unaccompanied when there isn’t a person present whose main responsibility is to take care of the child. Children who were separated from their parents before or during the flight from their country are also ‘unaccompanied’ children.
column16: Mtoto mkimbizi bila kuambatana na mzazi  kama hamna mtu mkubwa ambae ana majukumu ya kumlea na  kumwongoza yule mtoto. Watoto waliopoteana na wazazi kabla au wakati wa wapambano  wanaitwa pia 'Watoto wasio na wazazi'.

column14: Children seeking asylum without a parent/guardian must be referred to the Dept. of Social Development, where a social worker will be assigned to the case. The social worker must work with the DHA to help the child with the asylum application at a RRO. The social worker must also investigate the child's case & give a report. If the child doesn’t have an asylum claim, a legal counsellor must be contacted. Important: children must be documented or they risk becoming stateless.
column16: Mtoto akiomba hifadhi bila mzazi/mlezi lazima apelekwe kwenye Idara ya Maendelo ya Kajamii, penye mfanyi kazi wa jamii atashughulikia kesi yake. Mfanyi kazi wa jamii ataunga mkono na DHA kumsaidia mtoto kuomba hadhi RRO.  Atachunguza tena kesi ya mtoto & apeane ripoti kama mtoto hafai  hifadhi. La muhimu: Watoto lazima wapewe hati bila hivyo watakosa utaifa

column14: Renew your Section 22 asylum permit at your RRO office before it expires. Some RRO offices have a separate queue for renewals. Section 24 permits are valid for  2 to 4 years. Apply a week before your permit expires at a RRO. The Standing Committee of Refugee Affairs (SCRA) may review your refugee status in SA based on the situation in your home country. Tip: Take all original documents with you when renewing your permit.
column16: Gongesha upya kibali cha kifungu 22 cha  ukimbizi kabla hakijakwisha. Baadhi RRO ofisi  zina mistari tofauti.Kibali cha kigungu 24 kinakuwa   halali  miaka 2 au 4 . Omba kwenye RRO wiki moja  kabla haijaanguka. Kamati Simamizi Kwa Masuala ya Wakimbizi (SCRA) hufanya  mapitio  ya hifadhi yako kutokana na  hali ya nchi ya asili yako.Mwanga: Chukua nyaraka zote awali pamoja nawe wakati unaenda kugongesha  upya kibali chako.

column14: You'll be fined if you do not renew your permit before it expires. Payment of a fine means you are guilty of not renewing your permit on time and leads to a criminal record. If you have a good reason why you couldn't renew your permit, ask a lawyer for help. A RRO officer will give you the fine and tell you where to pay it. It's not more than R1000. If it is, see a lawyer. Renew your permit at the RRO where you applied for asylum. Tip: Permits are not renewed automatically.
column16: Utafainiwa kama hujafanya kibali yako upya. Malipo ya faini humaanisha hatia ya kutofanya kibali upya na utakuwa na  recordi ya uhalifu. Uliza wakili wako akusaidie kama una sababu inayoeleweka ya kuchelewa .RRO afisa atakupa faini na atakwambia  penye utailipia. Haizidi  R1000. Kama hivyo , ona wakili. gogengesha upya kibali  aple uliomba hadhi. Mwanga : Viibali  havifanywe upya moja kwa moja.

column14: Lost permit? Get a statement or affidavit at the police station. Submit the statement with a copy of your permit (if you can) at the RRO. Tip: Lost permits are hard to replace. Make certified copies to give to your family or keep it safe. Remember your permit’s file and case number.
column16: Je umepoteza kibali? Andika  kauli au  hati ya kiapo kituoni cha polisi. Peana kauli na nakala ya kibali (kama unaweza) kwa RRO. Mwanga : kibali kiki potea ni vigumu  kupata tena. Thibitishwa nakala na uziweke salama. Kumbuka faili namba za kibali na kesi namba.

column11: Vibali vya kukaa nchini muda mrefu
column14: Recognised refugees may apply for permanent residence. You must have lived in SA for 5 years in a row as a recognised refugee. Consult the Immigration Act of 2002 for more info on the requirements for a permanent residence application. It is important to get a certificate from the Standing Committee for Refugee Affairs (SCRA) saying you will remain a refugee indefinitely.
column16: Mkimbizi anayo tambulika huwezi omba makaazi ya kidumu. Lazima uishi SA zaidi ya miaka 5 mbichi. Shauri uhamaji 2002 kwa maelezo zaidi ya ombi maazi ya kidumu. Ni muhimu kuwa na cheti cha  Standing Committee for Refugee Affairs (SCRA) ya kuamba muda usio julikana.

column14: After 5 years of continuous refugee status, you can apply for permanent residence. Complete a certification application form from SCRA to confirm that you remain a refugee indefinitely. You can ask a legal counsellor like the LHR for help. This can take up to a year. Then submit the SCRA certificate and the documents required by the Immigration Act, to a regional DHA office (not RRO). Tip: Refugees don’t have to pay to submit a permanent residence application.
column16: Baada ya miaka 5  kuwa na hadhi ya ukimbizi, unaweza omba kibali cha kukaa muda mrefu .Jaza fomu ya kuomba cheti  kwa SCRA  kinahakikisha  kama utakuwa kimbizi kwa milele. Unaweza uliza washauri wa kisheria kama LHR usaidizi. Hii inaweza chukua mwaka moja. Alafu peleka cheti cha SCRA na hati maalum zinahitajiwa na ofisi ya uhamaji ya  DHA  (sio RRO) Mwanga: Wakimbizi hawafai kulipa kuomba kibali cha kukaa mdu mrefu.

column14: Asylum seekers and refugees are allowed to seek employment with their valid permits and are not required to obtain an extra work visa for this purpose.
column16: Waombaji wa ukimbizi na wakimbizi wana haki ya kutafuta kazi wakiwa na  kibali halali wala hawatakiwi kutafuta viza zaidi ya kikazi juu watumike.

column14: Register your business at the CIPC. Find out if it needs a licence, obtainable at a municipality for a small fee. You need copies of your permit and maybe extra documents like Health & Safety (H&S) inspection certificates. Don’t bribe the official! When your business meets the requirements, you'll get a licence and may start trading. A H&S officer may inspect your business site. You need to follow H&S rules at all times. Check the licence expiry date and renew it on time.
column16: Sajili biashara yako na CIPC. Jua liseni kupata kwa municipality na bei nafuu. Unahitaji copy ya kibali na ziada kama afya & usalama (H&S) ukiguzi vyeti. Utapata liseni na uanze biashara. A H&S afisa aeza chunguza tovuti. Unajitaji H&S sheria kila wakati. Angalia tarehe ya liseni kabla kuanguka. Andikisha biashara yako katika CIPC . Uliza Kama inahitaji leseni, ambao inapatikana  katika manispaa kwa ada ndogo. Unahitaji nakala za kibali chako na nyaraka mbali mbali zaidi   kama  Vyeti vya ukaguzi wa Idara ya Afya na Usalama ( H & S ) . Usilipe rushwa! ! Wakati biashara yako inaeneza mahitaji yote , utapata leseni na unaweza kuanza biashara . Afisa wa H & S anaweza kukagua eneo la  biashara yako. Unahitaji kufuata  sheria za H&S wakati wote. Angalia leseni itaisha  tarehe gani na uifanye  upya  kwa wakati.

column14: Check the law of the SA province you want to trade in. KZN/Limpopo/Mpumalanga/North West: you need a licence with Health & Safety approval. Limp: licences are valid for 1yr. Renew 1 month before expiry or risk fine/imprisonment. KZN: you can't alter the building you trade in without permission. Mpum: Hawkers/peddlars/street vendors don’t need a licence, but need proof that their stall area is assigned to them. Gauteng: Contact LHR for a copy of the law. See ‘Useful Services’.
column16: Angalia sheria za biashara majimbo ya SA. KZN/Limpopo/Mpumalanga/North West unahitaji liseni inuruhusiwa na Afya &Usalama  . Limp: Liseni iko mwaka 1. Fanya Upya mwezi 1 kabla  iishe au utafainiwa/fugungwa. KZN: Huwezi  kubadilsha mjendo kwa biashara bila ruhusa.Mpum : wachuuzi wa mitaani hawana haja ya leseni, lakini haja uthibitisho kwamba walipewa  ruhusa ya kufanya biashara  katika maeneo hao . Gauteng : Wasiliana na  LHR kwa kupata nakala ya sheria . Ongalia 'Huduma Muhimu'.

column14: The laws of a municipality are called by-laws. By-laws control the way businesses and services work in that area. Know the by-laws of the municipality you want to trade in. Tip: It’s important to obey all the by-laws. If you don’t follow the by-laws, you may lose your goods or go to jail. For the relevant by-laws see: www.capetwon.gov.za; www.tshwane.gov.za, www.durban.gov.za, www.nelsonmandelabay.gov.za or www.joburg.org.za
column16: Sheria ya munisipaa inaitwa sheria ndogo ndogo za mji. Zinahusika na  biashara na huduma ya miji. Jua sheria ya munisipaa  unaofanyia biashara. Mwanga : Ni muhimu kutii sheria. Usipofuata sheria, unaweza poteza mali yako au kufungwa.Kwa sheria zianozohusika  ongalia: www.capetown.gov.za, www.tshwane.gov.za, www.durban.gov.za, www.nelsonmandelabay.gov.za au www.joburg.org.za

column14: SECURITY/CAR GUARD: You must register at PSIRA. Only SA nationals, permanent residents and refugees with immunity can work as guards. TEACHER: If you are a public school teacher you need to check your international teaching qualification with the SA Qualifications Authority (SAQA). The SAQA evaluation doesn’t guarantee you a job. Also register with SA Council for Educators (SACE). Go to www.sace.org.za for more info.
column16: MLINZI / MLINZI WA MAGARI : Lazima ujiandikishe katika PSIRA .  Raia wa SA , Wakazi   na wakimbizi  ambao wana kinga ya kudumu wanaweza kufanya kazi kama walinzi. MWALIMU : Kama wewe ni mwalimu wa shule za umma  unahitaji kuangalia  vyeti vyako vya kimataifa kama vinafaa katika Mamlaka SA Sifa ( SAQA ). Tathmini ya SAQA haina dhamana ya kukupa kazi.  Pia jiandikishe na  Baraza la waelimishaji SA( Saces ). Nenda www.sace.org.za kwa maelezo zaidi.

column14: Refugees with foreign nursing qualifications must register with the South African Nursing Council (SANC). Visit www.sanc.co.za for a list of all documents you'll need to submit.
column16: Wakimbizi wenye fuzu wa uuguzi wasajili na South African Nursing Counsil (SANC). Nenda www.sanc.co.za kwa hati unasajili.

column14: Medical doctors with refugee status can apply to register as doctors in SA. The Department of Health (DOH) employs foreign doctors with the right qualifications & experience in govt. hospitals. Register with the Foreign Workforce Management Programme on 012-312-0467 – you need a job offer from a govt. hospital or health dept. Apply for a formal endorsement from FWMP. With a job offer & endorsement, apply to register with the Health Professions Council of SA on 012-338-9350.
column16: Madaktari wakimbizi waeza kusajili udaktari SA. Idara ya Afya (DOH) huajiri madaktari wageni wenye sifa & uzoefu wa hospitali za serikali. Sajili na Foreign Workforce Managment Programme kwa 012-312-0467  upate kazi hospitali za  serakalini.  au Idara ya  afya. Omba mhuri kwa FWMP. Ukipata Kazi na mhuri,omba sajili na Health Professions Counsil of SA kwa  012-338-9350.

column14: There are laws in SA that protect you from discrimination or unfair treatment when you are at work. Your employer can’t discriminate against you because you’re an immigrant. The law protects you from unfair treatment. The law also protects your minimum working hours, leave, salary and the way you are dismissed.
column16: Sheria SA inakataza ubaguzi au unyanyasaji kazini. Mwajiri hawezi kufanya ubaguzi kazini kwamba uko mgeni. Sheria hulinda wewe dhidi ya ubaguzi. Sheria pia inalinda wewe  masaa yako ya kazi, rikizo, mshahara na njia wewe ni ungefukuzwa kazini.

column14: You can claim from the UIF if you end up unemployed because you’re sick or have a baby. You need a 13-digit ID number to claim. If you are hurt or become infected with a disease at work and you end up being disabled, the Compensation Fund will pay out money. If you die because of your injuries, your dependants will get money. The Compensation Fund will help to pay the medical bills.
column16: Unaweza kudai kutoka UIF ukikaa bila ajira kwa sababu uko mgonjwa au ulijifungua. Unahitaji ID ya numbari13 ili udai.Kama uliambukizwa na magonjwa  kazini au  kuwa mlemavu, Mfuko wa fidia hulipa. Kama ukifa kwa sababu ya majeruha wategemezi watalipwa hela. Fedia ya fedha watalipa bili za matibabu.

column14: You have the right to basic health and reproductive health care services in SA. You cannot be refused emergency medical treatment. Hospital workers don’t always know the rights of refugees and asylum seekers with valid permits. You can contact Lawyers for Human Rights if you have a problem accessing public health services.
column16: Una haki ya afya uzazi afya huduma SA. Huweza kataliwa matibabu. Wafanyi kazi wa hospitali hawajui haki wakimbizi na ukimbizi wenye kibali halali. Unaweza pigia Lawyers for Human Rights kama unashida ya afya umma.

column14: Refugees and asylum seekers pay the same fees as SA nationals. Your fee is determined by a means test, which determines how much your fee will be subsidised. If you don't have the right documents, you'll pay the highest fee. Take the following with you: ID; permit; appointment card; payslip/proof of salary; proof of address. Tip: Sick? Go to a clinic close to home first – if they can't help, they'll give you a letter for a hospital. In an emergency, go straight to hospital.
column16: Wakimbizi na Waombaji wa Ukimbizi hulipa ada moja na raia ya SA. Ada inaamuliwa baada ya mtihani, ambayo huamua ada ruzuku. Kama hauna hati, utalipa ada bei juu. Peleka pamoja nawe yafuatao: ID, kibali; kadi ya uteuzi ; karatasi ya mshahara au ushahidi wa mapato, anuani. Mwanga : Mgonjwa? Nenda kliniki-kama hawasaidie, watakupa barua, nenda hospitali.

column14: Clinics provide treatment/medicine, mostly free. Make an appointment at your nearest clinic, unless it’s an emergency. Take your valid Section 22/24 permit. If you’re still waiting for yours, ask an NGO for a letter (see ‘Useful Services’). To go to hospital, you need a letter from the clinic unless it’s an emergency. Can’t pay the public hospital fees? Get an affidavit from the police to explain, or contact an NGO. DON’T go to a private Dr/hospital if you can’t pay the fees.
column16: Kliniki hutoa matibabu/dawa,kwa bure. Fanya uteuzi kliniki ilio karibu na we. Chukua kibali cha  kifungu  22/24.Kama hujapata, uliza NGO wakupe  barua ( ona 'Huduma Muhimu'). Kwenda  hospitali  unahitaji  barua kutoka kliniki labda ni dharura. Huwezi lipa ada umma? Chukua barua chini ya kiapo kituoni au pigia NGO. USIENDE hospitali  binafsi kama huwezi lipa gharama yao.

column14: Suffering traumatic events (abuse/violence/natural disaster) can lead to Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). Signs of PTSD: struggling to sleep/concentrate; nightmares; flashbacks; anxiety; helplessness; fear. Share your story if you have PTSD. In counselling you’ll talk about your experience/feelings. Visit the Trauma Clinic in Joburg or Trauma Centre for Survivors of Violence & Torture in Cape Town. There are other trauma clinics in SA. See ‘Contact List’ for more info.
column16: Mateso ya matukio ya kumiza (unyanyasaji/vurugu/janga la asili) yanaweza kukuletea Kiwewe baada ya matukio  (PTSD). Dalili ya PTSD:Kukosa usingizi/ mawazo,jinamizi,kumbukumbu, wasiwasi,hofu .Kama una PTSD ongea na watu. Tembelea kliniki ya Joburg au Kituo cha waathirika wa kiwewe unyanyasaji &mateso mjini  Cape Town. Kuna klinki zingine za Kiwewe SA. Ona 'Orodha wasiliano' kwa maelezo zaidi.

column14: HIV can go unnoticed for up to 10yrs. Know your status and get treatment sooner to help you lead a normal life. HIV weakens your body’s power to fight infections such as pneumonia. There is no cure. You can get HIV by having unprotected sex or using unsterilised needles/syringes. If you’re HIV+ and pregnant, your baby can get HIV in the womb, after birth or by breastfeeding. Tip: You can’t get HIV through casual contact, like working together, kissing, or sharing space.
column16: Ukimwi (VVU) unaweza kuenda bila kutambuliwa hadi miaka 10. Jua hali yako na pata matibabu mapema ili uishe maisha ya kawaida.VVU hudhoofisha mwili wako uwezo wa kupambana na maambukizi kama vile pneumonia, Hamna matibabu. Unaweza pata VVU ukifanya penzi bila kinga, kutumi  sindano chafu.Kama uko VVU+ na  mimba, ntoto anaweza kupata VVU tumboni, baada ya kuza au kumnyonyesha. Mwanga: Huwezi kupata VVU kwa kugusana, kufanya kazi pamoja, kumbusu au kuaa pamoja.

column14: To know your HIV status you need to get a blood test, available at most public health centres. The test is free. You’ll receive counselling before and after your test. Sometimes two tests are done. You’ll know your status after 20 minutes. Your blood sample might have to go to a laboratory, these results take a few days. HIV tests are very accurate. Many organisations in SA offer HIV tests, counselling and treatment. Go to www.tac.org.za or the contact list for more info.
column16: Kujua hali yako ya VVU ni lazima  upimwe damu katika vituo mbalimbali vya fya ya umma. Kupima damu ni bure. Pata ushauri kabla na baada ya kupimwa. Mara nyingine unapimwa mara mbili. Utajua hali yako baada ya dakika 20. Sampuli ya damu yako inaweza kupelekwa maabara, matokeo haya huchukua siku chache. Vipimo vya VVU ni sahihi. Mashirika mengi hupima  VVU , hushauri na hutoa matibabu hapa SA.Nenda www.tac.org.za au pigia listi ya mawasilano kwa habari zaidi.

column14: Pregnant women with HIV should ask for Nevirapine at public health centres. It can prevent HIV infection during childbirth. Nevirapine is an antiretroviral drug (ARV). Go to the contact list or www.tac.org.za for info on centres with ARV treatments.
column16: Wanawake wajawazito wenye VVU wanapaswa kuomba Nevirapine katika vituo vya afya vya umma. Zinaweza kuzuia maambukizi ya VVU wakati wa kujifungua. Nevirapine ni  madawa ya ukimwi (ARV) . Nenda kwenye orodha ya  kuwasiliana na orodha au www.tac.org.za kwa maelezo juu ya vituo vya matibabu ya ARV .

column14: Antiretroviral (ARV) treatment begins during a serious HIV-related illness or when your CD4 count drops below 350. Most people start ARV 8-10 years after infection. It isn’t the same for all. See a doctor and get the best treatment for you! Remember: It doesn’t matter what your permit/document status is – you are entitled to free ARV treatment.
column16: Mgonjwa huanza ARV wakati anaumwa vibaya na ugonjwa unaohusiana na VVU au wakati CD4 yake inashuka chini 350. Watu wengi huanza ARV miaka 8-10 baada ya kuambukizwa. Sio sawa kwa wote . Muone daktari na upate matibabu bora kwa ajili yako! Kumbuka : Usijali  kibali chako au hati yako - una haki ya matibabu bure ARV .

column14: If you wish to report a rape, go straight to the police. Don’t shower, drink liquids or use the toilet – this helps with evidence. You CAN change clothes, but take along the clothes you were wearing. You don’t need to report it to get medical treatment. If HIV negative before the assault, you have a right to a 28-day course of antiretrovirals to prevent HIV, but must take it within 72hrs. Help/info: LoveLife 0800 121 900; AIDS Helpline 0800 01 23 22; AIDS Hotline 0800 11 0605
column16: Ukitaka ripoti kubakwa, nenda moja kwa polisi. Usioge , usikunywe vinywaji au utumie choo - hii husaidia kwa Ushahidi . Wewe unaweza  badilisha nguo , lakini nenda pamoja na zile ulikuwa unavaa. Huna haja ya ripoti hiyo juu upewe matibabu. Kama ulikuwa huna VVU kabla ya kushambuliwa, una haki kupewa mwendo wa madawa ya kurefusha maisha na kuzuia VVU kwa  siku 28 , lakini ni lazima kuachukua  ndani ya masaa 72 . Msaada / maelezo : Lovelife 0800 121 900 ; UKIMWI Helpline 0800 01 23 22; UKIMWI Hotline 0800 11 0605

column14: Everyone has the right to basic education in SA. You must have a valid study permit to study in SA. In SA on another valid permit? Check first if your permit allows you to study in SA. Some conditions might apply.
column16: Kila mtu ana haki ya kupata elimu ya msingi  katika SA . Lazima uwe na kibali  halali cha kusoma nchini SA . Je una una kibali kingine halali Katika SA ? Angalia kibali chako  kwanza kama  kinakuruhusu kusoma nchini SA. Baadhi masharti  ambao anaweza kukuzuia.

column14: A creche is a preschool daycare centre for ages 1-6. Primary school: 7-13. Secondary school (academic or technical): 13-19. If you can't pay the fee, ask to work in exchange for a cheaper fee. Your child must have a visa and passport to be in SA. Children in SA must go to school – it’s the law. Tip: School age groups are flexible, so a child might be older than their classmates, but most government schools don't allow students to be 2yrs older than the grade’s age group.
column16: Creche in shule ya miaka 1-6. Shule ya msingi  7-13.Shule ya Sekondari (taalamu au kiufundi): 13-19. Kama huwezilipa ada, Uliza kufanya kazi badala  bei nafuu. Mtoto lazima awe na viza na pasipoti kuishi SA. Lazima watoto wende shule-ni sheria. Mwanga: Umri wa makundi shuleni ni rahisi, hivyo mtoto anaweza kuwa na umri mkubwa kuliko wenzake, lakini shule nyingi za serikali haziruhusu wanafunzi kuwa miaka 2 zaidi ya umri wa daraja.

column14: Asylum & refugee kids have the same right to primary education as SA kids. Register for a primary school closest to your house. English not good? Take a friend with who can help. Schools get full quickly so apply early (from July). If the school closest to your house is full, the school must show you another school that can help. If you struggle to register, the school close to your house must refer you to the Dept. of Education (DOE). If the school refuses admission, ask for a letter on their letterhead signed by the principal and take it to the DOE. Still can’t find a school? Contact a social service provider for education or LHR. More info on the contact list.
column16: Watoto wa waombaji wa kimbizi &wakimbizi wana haki ya masoma  ya msingi kama watoto wa SA..Sajili katika shule za msingi  karibu na we. Chukua rafik mabe anaweza kukusaidia. Shule zinajaa haraka omba mapema (kutoka July). Kama shule imejaa, watakuonyesha  shule nyingine ya kukusaidia .Kama inashindikana karibu nawe, watakutuma kwenye  Idara ya Elimu ( kusajili mtoto , omba barua ambo inasainiwa na mkurugenzi uipeleke DOE. Kama bado hupati shule ? Wasiliana na na mfanyakazi wa kutoa huduma za elimu au LHR.Angalia kwe Orodha ya mawasiano kupata habari zaidi.

column14: The parent or legal guardian must register the child. Give your family’s contact details: physical address, postal address and telephone numbers. Provide the school with certified copies of the child and/or parent’s permit and the child’s inoculation certificate. If you don’t have an inoculation certificate you must get one within 3 months from the local municipal clinic.
column16: Mzazi au mlezi asajili mtoto. Patia familia mawasiliano: anuani, anuani posta na numbari simu. Kutoa na kuthibitishwa copies ya mtoto/ mzazi kibali cha chanjo. Kama hauna chanjo cha mtoto lazima upate na miezi 3 kwa local munisipaa klink.

column14: If you can’t pay school fees, ask the school to reduce them by completing an exemption form. You must show proof of income (payslip/affidavit/letter of support) & give info on your expenses & responsibilities. Apply for exemption at the start of each term. Keep all letters & appointments with the school. If you ignore notices the school can make you pay. Find a NGO in the contact list for help with the form. Uniforms & learning materials also cost money. If you can’t afford a uniform, your child can wear clothes that resemble it, but must still go to school. Second-hand uniforms are cheaper. Ask at the school. You shouldn’t pay a registration fee. Public schools can’t ask your child to leave if you can’t pay.
column16: Kama lipa ada ya shule, uliza wakupunguzie fomu. Lazima ushahidi ya (payslip/kiapo/burua msaada) & majukumu. Omba msamaha. Weka barua zote&uteuzi ya shule. Ukipuuza unaweza lipa. Pigia NGO kusadia na sare. Kama mtoto hana sare avae inayo fanana. Uliza shule. Kama hujalipa kusajili. Shule ya umma hawaezi kuliza hela.

column14: Children with special learning needs can go to a special education school. Contact the Department of Education and ask about schools. Placing your child in a special education school is a long process. Get your child on a waiting list as soon as possible.
column16: Watoto wenye mafunzi maalum unaweza enda shule maalum. Pigia Department of Education na ulize shule zao. Kupeleka mtoto wako shule maalum ni mchakato. Patia mtoto wako listi ya kuongoja haraka.

column14: You can study at a university to further your education or change your education from your home country to a SA degree. A university degree can help you to get into the SA job market. As a refugee, tertiary education is not guaranteed. You can apply to study at a university or technikon. A technikon is a university of technology with more practical training. Contact the international student office at your chosen university or technikon. Ask for info about their standards.
column16: Unaweza soma university kuzidisha elimu yako au kubadilisha elimu ya nyumbani kama degree. Univerity huweza kusadia kuendeleza kuwa kazi. Mkimbizi elimu sio uhakika. Unaweza omba university au ufundi. Ufundi ni shule ya vitendo. Pigia international student office uliochagliwa university au ufundi. Uliza maelezo zaidi.

column14: You must pay international registration & local tuition fees. Submit the completed SAQA form with SAQA-certified copies of your academic records. Process can take 3 months. Prove your English proficiency by taking a TOEFL, IELTS or PTEEP test. Scholarship funding & info available online or at the uni/tech’s info desk. UNHCR offers a Dafi Scholarship for refugees under 28yrs who’ve completed secondary education (not for postgrad). See ‘Useful Services’ for info & requirements.
column16: Utalipa  ada za kimataifa & ada za mitaa kujisajili shuleni. Wasilisha fomu iliyokamilika  pamoja na SAQA - nakala zilizothibithishwa za  rekodi zako za kitaaluma . Mchakato inaweza kuchukua miezi 3 . Thibitisha ustadi wako Kiingereza kwa kuchukua mthihani ya  TOEFL , IELTS au PTEEP. Udhamini fedha & maelezo inapatikana online au katika  ofisi za maelezo za vyuo vikuu / vyuo fundi. UNHCR inatoa Dafi Scholarship kwa wakimbizi chini ya miaka 28 walipomaliza Elimu ya Sekondari ( si shahada ya juu ). Angalia ' Huduma muhimu ' kwa maelezo & Mahitaji .

column14: Some NGOs and refugee communities offer adult education to refugees and asylum seekers. Most adult education programmes are free. Some training centres offer English language courses. Self-help programmes and skills training can be important for job seekers. Adult education programmes also encourage social integration in SA. See ‘Useful Services’ for more info.
column16: NGO na jamii ya wakimbizi husaida watu wazima na elimu ya bure. Mipango ya elimu in bure. Mahali pengine hupeana lugha ya kingereza. Mipango ya kujisaidia na mafunzo ni muhimo wanaotafuta kazi. Mipango ya husaidia mashirikiano SA. Ona 'Huduma Muhimu' maelezo zaidi.

column14: You have the right to food, water and housing. Some organisations can help vulnerable asylum seekers and refugees with this. Remember: Help is limited and for a short time only. You will be expected to support yourself soon afterwards. Some churches and religious centres run soup kitchens or provide help to asylum seekers and refugees. See ‘Useful Services’  for more info on these churches and religious centres.
column16: Unahaki ya chakula,maji na makaazi. Organisation husaidia mlemavyo na wakimbizi kwa hii. Kumbuka usaidizi ni kwa muda. Unahitaji kujisaida kibinafsi. Kama kanisa na centa ya dini hutoa usaidizi kwa wakimbizi. Ona 'Huduma Muhimu' maelezo ya hii kanisi centa ya kidini.

column14: Some NGOs might help you find short-term solutions, like a shelter or place for the homeless. See ‘Useful Services’ for info. Ask other refugees and asylum seekers for info on accommodation. Check local newspapers for ads. Estate agents can charge a fee. Rent is paid at the beginning of the month. You might have to pay a deposit (a month’s rent) before you can move in. If possible, sign a contract with your landlord. Ask him/her what they expect of you as a tenant.
column16: NGO hupatian ufumbizi wasio na makaazi.Ona 'Huduma Muhimu' maelezo. Uliza wakimbizi kwa maelezo makaazi.Angia gazeti matangazo. Makala hulipa ada. Koli hulipwa. Unafaa kuliapa amana (miezi) kabla kuingia. Ikiwezekana,saini mwenye nyumba. Uliza magizo kama wewe mpangaji.

column14: The law also protects refugees and asylum seekers from unlawful evictions. The landlord must have a court order before he can evict you. Remember: only a court can force you to leave. The landlord cannot threaten you or use force to remove you from the property. Contact the Rental Housing Tribunal on 011-630-5035 or 0800-046-873 if there’s a dispute or if you feel you’ve been unfairly treated.
column16: Sheira hulinda wakimbizi kinyume cha sheria. Mwenye mali awe na mahakama kabla kukutoa. Kumbuka. Mahakana ina nguvu kuondoa. Mwenye mali hawezi kukutishia kukufuza kwa mali yake. Pigia Rental Housing Tribunal kwa 011-630-5035 au

column14: It may be difficult to open a bank account in SA. Banks don’t always know the rights of refugees and asylum seekers with valid permits. They may refuse to open bank accounts. Asylum seekers can use their temporary asylum seeker permit as identification. Refugees can use their refugee permit or refugee ID. FNB, Standard Bank and Nedbank accept asylum seekers and refugees. Ask other refugees which bank in your area is refugee-friendly.
column16: Ni vigumu kufunguwa akaunti ya benki SA. Benki hawajui haki ya wakimbizi wenye kibali halali. Wanaeza kataa kukufungulia akaunti. Wakimbizi wanaeza kutumia vibali vyao kufungua akaunti . Wanatumia vibali vya hifadhi au ID vitambulisho. Benki kama FNB,Standard Bank na Nedbank wanasaidia wakimbizi. Uliza marafiki benki katika eneo lako ambao zinakaribisha wakimbizi.

column14: You must be 16 years or older with a valid permit or refugee ID. You must hand in a proof of residence: a rental contract, telephone bill or utility bill in your name. You need to prove your income with a payslip or affidavit. You also need a small amount of money to put in your bank account. Even if you have the right documents, the bank may decide if they want to give you an account or not. You can also ask a legal counsellor to help you open a bank account.
column16: Lazima uwe na umri wa miaka 16 na kibali au ID. Uwe na ushahidi wa anuani, mkataba wa kodi,bili ya simu, bili shirika kwenye majina yako. Ushahidi wa  mapato  au kiapo. Unahitaji pia pesa kwa benki. Kama una hati sahihi, benki itamua kukupa akauntu. Unaeza uliza pia mshauri kisheria usaidizi wa  kufungua akaunti ya benki.

column14: Savings and credit co-operatives often open up bank accounts for refugees. They operate as credit unions. Credit unions are groups of people who save together and lend money to each other. They don’t operate as ordinary banks.
column16: Akiba na ushirika hufungulia wakimbizi akaunti.vyama ya mikopo. Vinatumika kama Vyama mikopo.Ni makundi ya  watu huweka akiba na kukopesha pesa pamoja. Hawatumiki kama benki za kawaida.

column14: Recognised refugees can get social assistance under certain circumstances. This doesn’t apply to asylum seekers.
column16: Wakimbizi wanaotambulika hupata usaidizi wa kijamii kutokana na hali yao. Haiombi wanaotafuta hifadhi

column14: This is a temporary or permanent monthly grant for recognised refugees who can’t work due to a mental or physical disability. Recognised refugees who are foster parents of a disabled child under 18 can apply for a care dependency grant.
column16: Msaada wa kila mwezi utakuwa wa muda au kudumu kwa wakimbizi wanajulikana ambao hawaezi fanya kazi kwa sababu ya ulemavyo. Wakimbizi wanatambulika kuwa walezi wa mtoto mlemavu chini ya miak 18  huweza omba utegemezi ruzuku.

column14: Recognised refugees who are suitable foster parents can apply to the Department of Social Development for a foster care grant. Remember: a court must confirm you are a suitable foster parent. The grants are usually given for a 2 year period.
column16: Wakimbizi ambao  ni walezi wa watoto wanaweza omba Idara ya Maendelo ya Kijamii ruzuku ya walezi. Kumbuka: mahakama huthibitisha kama mzazi mlezi. Ruzuku huchukua kama miaka 2.

column14: Social relief is limited to SA citizens and recognised refugees. You would need to apply at the nearest SASSA office where you live. Each grant requires different documents to be submitted.
column16: Msaada ya jamii hupewa raia wa SA na wakimbizi wanaojulikana. Omba  ofisini SASSA  karibu na we. Kila ruzuku inahitaji hati fulani.

column14: Each grant needs a specific set of documents to support your application. Visit the South Africa Social Security Agency's website (www.sassa.gov.za) or call them on 0800-60-10-11. You must apply at the SASSA office closest to your home.
column16: Kila ruzuku inahitaji hati maalum. Tembelea South Africa Social Security Agency's website (www.sassa.gov.za) au pigia 0800-60-10-11. Omba SASSA kwenye ofisi ilio karibu na we.

column14: Xenophobia is an irrational hatred towards foreigners or an unreasonable fear or hatred of the unfamiliar persons. If you are a victim of xenophobic attacks, you must report it to the police. Go to the police station closest to your home. You must explain in detail what happened. The police will open a case. You will get a case number. Keep it safe! If you’ve lost your document, get an affidavit from the police that explains your situation. Go to the RRO for a new permit.
column16: Xenophobia ni chuki dhidi ya wageni. Kama wewe mwathirika ,nenda kituo cha polisi ilio karibu na wewe.Polisi itakufungulia kesi number. Weke vizuri! Ukipoteza hati yako,pata kiapo kwa polisi waeleze kilichopitikana. Nenda RRO kwa kibali mpya.

column14: Sometimes UNHCR helps to move refugees from one place to another ('relocation'). There are 4 relocation options: resettlement, internal relocation, voluntary repatriation and family reunification. Relocation is not part of the asylum process, and only exceptional cases will be considered for recognised refugees if the UNHCR identifies the need for protection. The UNHCR will carry out a separate status interview, and their outcome can differ from the DHA’s process.
column16: Mara nyingine UNHCR huhamisha  wakimibizi. Kuna aina 4 za chaguo: kupelekwa nchi nyingine, .Kuhamishwa nchini , Kurudi kwao na kuunganisha familia. Kuhamishwa si mchakato wa kuomba ukimbizi, lakini kuna kesi muhimu tu zitashughulikiwa za wakimbizi pekee  ambao wanahitaji usalama. UNHCR itafanya mahojiano na matukio inaweza kuwa tofauti na mchakato wa DHA..

column14: Resettlement is the assisted movement of a refugee and his/her nuclear family (husband/wife and children) to another country. This is only done in exceptional cases, if SA officials cannot find a safe solution for the affected refugees in SA. General SA problems like crime or xenophobia do not meet the requirements for resettlement. The UNHCR will first try to set up a durable environment for you in SA before resettlement is considered.
column16: Kuhamishwa ni usaidizi ya wakimbizi yeye/zake nyuklia famia (bwana/bibi na watoto) nchi ingine. Hii ni kesi kipekee,kama afisa SA hawezi linda wakimbizi SA. Shida ujumla kama uhalifu au xenophobia haikidhi kuhamishwa.UNHCR itasaidia na maazi kabla uamuzi wa kuhamishwa.

column14: If SA officials cannot find a safe solution for the affected refugees in SA, then relocation options must be considered. Ask a legal counsellor for help if you fall within one of the 4 relocation categories. SA problems like crime, xenophobia or lack of employment do not meet the requirements for resettlement. The UNHCR will first try to set up a durable environment for you in SA before resettlement is considered.
column16: Kama serikali ya SA haipati  suluhisho salama kwa wale wakimbizi,  kisha itahitajika chaguzi la kuhamishwa .Mshauri wa kisheria atakusaidia kutambua kama umo katika yale makundi 4 ya kuahamishwa.Matatizo ka uhalifu , chuki didi ya wageni, Ukofevu wa kaz si sababu ya kuhamishwa.UNHCR  itajaribu kwanza kugeuza mazingira  kabla ya uamuzi wa kuhamishwa.

column14: Go to the UNHCR on a Monday to make an appointment. Their consultation days are Tuesdays and Thursdays. UNHCR will assess your case to see if you qualify. If the decision is negative, they will notify you in writing. If the UNHCR decides that resettlement is necessary, they will ask a third country to review your application. If the third country is satisfied with your case, you may need to interviewed again and go for a medical examination. The process can take 1–2 years.
column16: Nenda UNHCR Jumatatu kufanya uteuzi. Mashauriano ni Jumanne na Alhamisi. UNHCR watakadiria  kesi yako na ukifaulu watakutimia barua. UNHCR wakiamua uhamaji ni muhimu, wataomba inchi nyingine iangalie ombi lako. Kama inchi ikikubali  kesi yako, utaanza tena mahojiano  na utaenda ukufanya chunguzi wa afya. Mchakato huweza kua miaka 1-2.

column14: Internal relocation is the movement of a refugee/asylum seeker & their families within SA, for protection purposes. In exceptional situations you may be relocated for better access to the UNHCR. Internal relocation procedures are the same as resettlement. You can’t apply simply for transportation. If the UNHCR thinks you need internal relocation, they'll find you a safer location. Temporary accommodation & necessary services can be provided. The UNHCR will arrange transport.
column16: Uhamaji harakati ya wakimbizi/ukimbizi na familia SA,ulindaji. Kesi kipekee huweza pelekwa kwa UNHCR. Uhamaji na hanunua ni sawa na uhamaji. Huwezi omba usafiri. UNHCR  huthani unahitaji uhamaji,. Muda makaazi & umihimu inahitajika. UNHCR hupanga usafiri.Uhamishwaji  nchini ni harakati ya wakimbizi /  mwombaji wa ukimbizi & familia zao ndani ya SA , kwa madhumuni ya ulinzi. Katika hali ya kipekee unaweza kuhamishwa kwa upatikanaji bora wa UNHCR. Taratibu za ndani kuhamishwa ni sawa na kupelekwa nje . Huwezi kuomba tu kwa ajili ya usafiri . Kama UNHCR anadhani unahitaji kuhamishwa ndani, wao itabidi wapate eneo salama. Nyuma  na huduma muhimu wanaweza kutolewa kwa muda . UNHCR hupanga usafiri.

column14: Voluntary repatriation is when refugees freely decide to return to their home countries. To apply, you must fill in an application form at UNHCR, LHR, Wits or UCT Law Clinics. You'll be interviewed by a legal counsellor, who must confirm that the info on your form is correct. Your form will be sent with a recommendation to the UNHCR or the IOM. They will make a decision and arrange your return. Tip: You'll lose refugee status if you leave SA through voluntary repatriation.
column16: Kurejea kwao hiari ni wakati  wakimbizi waamuru weneyewe kurudi  kwao. Omba, lazima ujaze fomu UNHCR, LHR, Wits or UCT law Clinics. Utahojiwa na mwanasheria, Thibitisha taarifa iko kwenye fomu. Fomu yako itapekelekwa  UNHCR au IOM. Uamuzi utachukuliwa na utarudihwa nyumbani.Mwanga: Utapoteza hadhi yako ukitoka SA kwa kurejea kwako.

column14: If you lost contact with a family member during the movement between countries, you can ask for the family member to join you in SA. You may ask to join a family member in another country. Under exceptional circumstances the UNHCR can help with transportation. To apply, contact the UCT Law Clinic, LHR or Jesuit Refugee Services, who'll help you with the application. Tip: Family reunification applications must be made to the DHA at the RRO.
column16: Ukipoteza mawalisiano na mtu wa familia njiani, unaweza kumomba akufuate SA. Unaweza kujiunga naye nchi nyingine. Chini ya mazingira UNHCR inaweza kukusaidia usafiri. Kuomba:  Pigia Law Clinicya UCT, LHR au Jesuit Refugee Services, watakusaida kuomba. Mwanga: kuunganisha familia hufanywa na  DHA katika ofisi ya  RRO.

column14: The SARCS, ICRC & UNHCR help trace & reunite families, and assist with child protection during the process. Red Cross can help reunite unaccompanied & separated kids, as well as the elderly/vulnerable. The Red Cross message system helps restore contact between family members if their IDs & addresses are known. Always give as much info as possible: missing person’s ID; reason for separation; last place of contact. Consult Red Cross & Red Crescent if the missing person was resettled. Finding a missing person depends on info given & the accessibility of the area they’re in. Armed conflicts/natural disasters may delay the process.
column16: SARCS, ICRC & UNHCR husaidia kuunganisha familia na ulinzi wa watoto. Red Cross husaidia familia kuungana kama watoto waliyopotea,  wazee/vilema. Red Cross inatoaga  ujumbe ambao husaidia mawasialano na kuungana na familia kama ID na anuani binajulikana .Ni lazima utoe taarifa kamili kama ID ya mtu aliyopotea, sababu na mara ya mwisho ya kwasiliana naye.Kama mtu alipelekwa nchi nyingine ongea na Red Cross & Red Cressent. Kumpata mtu vinategemea maelezo ilitolewa.Vita/maafa ya  asili ivinaweza  kuchelewesha mchakato.

column14: SA’s Constitution protects the rights of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender individuals (LGBTI). LGBT victims of unjust treatment must go to the police. LGBT victims of hate speech may lay a complaint with the SAHRC or approach the Equality Court for relief.
column16: SA's hulinda haki ya Lesbian, Gay Bisexual na Transgender kipekee (LGBTI). Wathirika kudhulumu matibabu ya LGBT enda kituo cha polisi. Waathirika lugha ya chuki didi ya  LGBTfungua laumu  kwenye SAHRC au neda  mahakama kwa ajili ya masaada.

column14: The Refugee Act states that the LGBTI group may get protection if they are persecuted for their sexual orientation. Don’t be afraid to disclose your sexual orientation when applying for asylum. The RRO must treat your claim with confidentiality.
column16: Sheria ya Wakimbizi  hulinda na hutetea LGBTI kama  wanateswa kwa mwekeleo wa kijinsia. Usiogope kusema ujinsia wako ukiomba hadhi. RRO huchukulia madai yako siri.

column14: Contact Lawyers for Human Rights (LHR) or another legal organisation if your claim isn’t treated with sensitivity and respect. www.lhr.org.za; 011-339-1960 or 012-320-2943.
column16: Wasiliana na Wanasheria wa Haki za Binadamu (LHR) au shirika lingine kisheria kama madai yako haijatibiwa na unyeti na heshima. www.lhr.org.za; 011-339-1960 au 012-320-2943.

column14: Abuse is illegal in SA. Get free legal help from selected women and children’s organisations, or call the toll-free helpline on 0800-150-150 for help and counselling.
column16: Unyanyasaji ni haramu SA. Pata shauri ya kisheria  bure atika mashirika machache anayosaidia wa   wanawake na watoto , au piga  simu  kwa 0800-150-150  upate msaada na ushauri nasaha.

column14: Women and children have the right to live free from abuse. All types of abuse must be reported to the police. A protection order can prevent more violence. Violence can be intimidation, physical, sexual or verbal abuse, being threatened with abuse or when you lose your freedom. Abuse of women and children is illegal in SA.
column16: Wamama na watoto wana haki ya kutonyanyaswa. Kila unyanyasaji ni lazima uripotiwe kwa polisi. Amri ya ulinzi huzuia vurugu zaidi. Vurugu hua vitisho mwili,ngono au matusi, kutishiwa na vurugu au  ukipoteza uhuru wako. Unyanyasaji wa wanawake na watoto ni haramu SA.

column14: If you or your child suffer from abuse, you must report it to the police. The police will open a criminal case. You must make a statement. You’ll get a case number. An officer will investigate your case. Some police stations have special units for domestic violence, sexual offences and child protection. Go to a police station close to your home. If you don’t, your case will take longer to process. You’ll go for a medical examination and counseling.
column16: Mtoto wako akinyayaswa, lazima uripoti kwa polisi. Polisi atafungua kesi. Lazima unadike kauli. Afisa atachunguza kesi. Vituo vingine vina vitengo  maalum. Nenda kituoni  karibu na we. Usipoenda, kesi yako itachukua muda.  Nenda uchuguzi wa afya na ushauri nasaha.

column14: If you’re afraid of more violence or feel threatened, you can go to court and get a protection order. You don’t need a lawyer. A protection order can order your abuser to stop abusing you, to stay away from you or force him/her out of your home. Documents like medical reports and photos of your injuries can help your case. Take them with you to court. With enough proof, you’ll get an interim protection order and suspended warrant of arrest.
column16: Kama unaogopa vitendo au kitishiwa, unaweza kuenda mahakama. Huhitaji wakili. Amri ya Ulinzi inaweza kukataza kunyanyasa, kumkalisha mbali na wewe na kumfukuza nyumbani . Hati kama ripoti ya  afya na picha majeruhi  vipeleke makahamani .Ni ushahidi wa kutosha. Utapata amri ya ulinzi na kibali cha kukamatwa.

column14: If the abuser disobeys the order, you can get him/her arrested. You’ll need to go back to court a second time. Your abuser must also be there. The court will listen to your case. The court may give you a final protection order. If your abuser disobeys the order, he/she can get arrested.
column16: Kama mnyanyasaji akidharau amri ya mahakama, unaweza kumfungisha. Utarudi mahakamani naye atakuwepo.  Mahakana itasikiriza kesi. Mahakama yaweza kupa amri ya ulinzi ya mwisho. Mnyanyasaji akileta matusi tena unaweza kufungwa.

column14: Human trafficking happens when people are recruited and taken to another country under a false act. They’re exploited and cannot leave. Trafficked victims are tricked with false promises of good jobs and better lives and forced to work under brutal and inhumane conditions. Human trafficking is a form of modern-day slavery. Call the International Organisation for Migration (IOM) on 0800-555-999 or go to a police station if you know of someone who has been trafficked.
column16: Biashara ya binadamu ni kuajiri watu na kuwapelaka  kinyama. Wanateswa vibaya na habawezi toka. Wathirika wanasafirishwa kwa ahadi za uongo kama kazi nzuri au maisha bora na walazimishwa kufanya kazi za haramu katika  hali ya kinyama. Biashara ya binadamu ni aina ya  kisasa ya utumwa. Pigia  Shirika la Kimataifa la Uhamiaji (IOM)  kwenye  0800-555-999 au nenda kituo cha  polisi kama unamfahamu mtu aliesafirishwa.

column14: A stateless person doesn’t have citizenship in any country. You are also at risk of being stateless if your nationality status is undecided. Not all undocumented persons are considered stateless, e.g. when your birth isn’t registered or if you don’t have a birth certificate, ID or passport.
column16: Mtu bila utaifa hana uraia wa nchi yeyote. Uko kwa hatari kama utaifa wako hauja amuliwa. Watu bila vitambulisho hujulikana wakosa utaifa. Kama hauna cheti cha kuzaliwa,ID au pasipoti.

column14: An undocumented person risks being stateless when he/she belongs to a certain category or certain factors are present. Examples: birth outside your parents’ country of nationality; death or desertion of your parent(s); irregular migration across international borders; mixed nationality of your parents, loss of clinic cards or records; if you’re close to an international border with high cross-border movement or when the law doesn’t allow you to have dual nationality.
column16: Mtu bila kitambulisho anaweza kukosa utaifa wake kama ana jamii au kundi fulani. Kwa mfano: kuzaliwa nje ya nchi asili ya wazazi'; kifo au kupoteleana na wazazi. kawaida uhamaji wa mipaka kimataifa; kuwa na wazazi wenye uraia tofauti, kupoteza kadi ya kliniki; kama uko karibu ya  mipaka ya kimataifa au sheria haikuruhusu utaifa mbili.

column14: A birth certificate proves your place of birth and identifies your parent/s. It’s also the most important proof of your nationality. South African citizens born outside SA are entitled to a SA birth certificate. Foreign children born in SA are entitled to a birth certificate. This doesn’t mean they’re SA citizens. Children born in SA must be registered within 30 days otherwise, apply for late birth registration. Applications close in December 2015.
column16: Cheti cha kuzaliwa huonyesha mahali pa kuzaliwa na hubainisha wazazi. Ni ushaidi  muhimu wa uraia. Raia wa SA waliozaliwa nje ya SA wanakuwa na haki ya cheti cha SA .Watoto wa kigeni walizaliwa SA wana haki ya kuwa cheti cha Kuzaliwa , lakini haimanishi ni raia wa SA. Watoto lazima wasajiliwe ndani ya siku 30, maombi ya usajili wa kuchelewa  utakoma  katika  Decemba 2015.

column14: You have a claim to SA citizenship if: you were born to a parent with SA citizenship at the time of your birth; you were born in SA to a parent who was a permanent resident of SA at the time of your birth and if you lived in SA until the age of 18; you have been adopted by a SA citizen; applied for and received a certificate of naturalisation from the DHA; were born in SA and have no other citizenship or nationality, or no right to other citizenship or nationality.
column16: Unaweza kudai uraia wa SA kama: Umezaliwa na mzazi ana uraia wa SA wakati alipokuzaa; umezaliwa SA na mzazi ambaye ana kibali cha kukaa muda mrefu na wewe uliishi SA hadi  uko na umri wa miaka 18; umepitishwa na raia SA.; uliomba vyeti ya uraia kwa DHA na ukapewa ;  umezaliwa SA na hauna utaifa nyengine, huna haki ya utaifa au uraia nyingine.

column14: If you struggle to register a birth or access nationality in your country of birth, contact LHR on 011-339-1960 or 012-320-2943 for legal advice or assistance.
column16: Kama una shida ya kupata cheti cha kuzaliwa au kupata utaifa katika  nchi yako asili,pigia LHR kwa 011-339-1960 au 012-320-2943 kwa ushauri au  usaidizi kisheria.

column14: The asylum process is hard and can include weeks of queueing. If arrested while waiting for your Section 22 permit, contact LHR for help. If a DHA official asks for a bribe, take down his/her name, physical features, the date and time. Call 0800-601-190 (toll-free) to report anonymously. No need to pay any fees. Renew your Section 22 permit before expiry or risk being arrested/detained/fined. If you use it to get back into your country, you could lose your SA refugee status.
column16: Mchakato wa kuomba ukimbizi ni mgumu unameza kumaliza  muda zaidi ya  wiki kwenye  laini. Ukifungwa na ulikuwa unasubili  kifungu 22,Pigia LHR kwa usaidizi. Kama DHA afisa  akikuuliza honga, chukua jina lake, wakati na muda. Piga 0800-601-190 (Simu bure )kutoa  ripoti . Gogesha Upya Kifungu 22 kabla kuanguka au utafungwa/uta pelekwa kuzuizini/fainiwa. column14: Remember to take all original documents with you when renewing your permit. You have the right to question the fine if you think it’s wrongly given to you. column14: Resettlement is possible in exceptional cases, but not an option for many refugees with SA refugee status. It can take more than a year.
